text: As sent by Susan on Wednesday…

metadata.topic: RE: Printer names and icons might be changed and HP Smart...
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] RE: Printer names and icons might be changed and HP Smart...
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from calvin@mcltech.ca. Learn why this is important
[https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
As sent by Susan on Wednesday… 
From: 'Susan Bradley' via PatchManagement <patchma...@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, December 19, 2023 00:25
To: patchma...@googlegroups.com
Subject: Re: [patchmanagement] HP Smart/Printer Metadata Troubleshooter 
It just came out. 
·         When it is run by enterprise administrators, correcting printers for
all users and sessions on a system requires running the tool as the Local System
account. Tools such as PsExec
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.microsoft.com%2Fsysinternals%2Fdownloads%2Fpsexec&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Ced740acc5db943a3c41608dc02d2d6fe%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638388353533539027%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C41000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=bZMyPIqUgQCXerMKGzXrSvD1YqV%2FCcElfM6OnVJFOSA%3D&reserved=0] or
Windows Task Scheduler
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.microsoft.com%2Fwindows%2Fwin32%2Ftaskschd%2Fschtasks&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Ced740acc5db943a3c41608dc02d2d6fe%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638388353533539027%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C41000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=pRnVJ9tOcyFO5O2t14pkmA6yYzQoJZsJ9hLKuV0kzIo%3D&reserved=0] can
run commands as Local System. 
·         When it is run by users managing their own printers, this tool must be
run using administrative credentials
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.microsoft.com%2Ftroubleshoot%2Fwindows-server%2Fshell-experience%2Fuse-run-as-start-app-admin&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Ced740acc5db943a3c41608dc02d2d6fe%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638388353533539027%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C41000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=laidYUPtyz7T3HR7L76VWkpmDviFyPnQDx7V7xEO6l8%3D&reserved=0].
The following are recommended steps to execute the file and confirm it worked: 
a.  Click Start, type cmd, right-click Command Prompt, and then select Run as
Administrator. 
b.  In the opened command prompt, type cd /d “[path_to_downloaded_tool]” and
then press Enter. 
c.   Type the name of the file appropriate for your device from the list below
(for instance PrintMetadataTroubleshooterX86.exe) and then press Enter. 
Be aware that you can't just click on the gui. 
From: 'Ira Shapiro' via PatchManagement
[mailto:patchmanagement@googlegroups.com]
Sent: December 21, 2023 7:32 PM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Cc: ycats610@verizon.net
Subject: RE: [patchmanagement] RE: Printer names and icons might be changed and
HP Smart... 
Hi, 
Has a fix been issued for this?  Today was my first encounter with a customer
having the problem.  I removed the unneeded HP Smart App (he has no HP printers
but used to).  “Printers and Devices” in Control Panel still shows HP M101-106
 IDs for all the printers.  This user had functional issues too where jobs were
going to the wrong queue.  Has a fix been issued that puts things back to
normal? 
Thanks, 
Ira Shapiro
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/A6699D0A6010FD4890DEC629AEF6FADFAC6A73F8%40MCLTECH-SBS.mcltech.local
